name: Idolic Deity
description: The Idolic Deity resembles a small statue, enhanced by a remarkable Dexterity and Charisma, signifying its stealth and deceptive capabilities in combat. It can blend into its surroundings and can move through objects.
memorable: Its Apostasy Aura disrupts divine powers, making it a significant threat to clerics and paladins.
goals: To undermine and corrupt those who wield divine or celestial power.
relations: Its abilities make it particularly dangerous to divine spellcasters and paladins.
environment: Often found in dark or obscured areas where it can utilize its stealth.
strengths: High Dexterity and Charisma, exceptional stealth and deception skills, immunity to several damage types and conditions, and the ability to disrupt spellcasting.
weaknesses: Weak against magical attacks and dependent on stealth for effectiveness.
attacks: Utilizes the Seduce the Righteous ability to impose disadvantage on foes, followed by powerful Slam attacks dealing bludgeoning and psychic damage.
most_powerful_ability: Apostasy Aura, which causes divine powers to fail, posing a significant challenge to divine allies.
senses: It has darkvision allowing it to see in low light conditions.
skills: Skilled in Deception and Stealth, enhancing its ability to evade and manipulate.
additional_information: Construct nature means it doesn't require food, air, or sleep.
Can take on a False Appearance and blend seamlessly with surroundings.
Incorporeal Movement grants tactical advantages in combat.
Immunities to poison and psychic damage.
test_queries: corrupting statue that disrupts divine power
stealthy construct that poses a threat to clerics
small deity that punishes divine spellcasters
tactical foe that can blend into surroundings
